folder: East End Avenue & 84th Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
View across excavation at N. W. corner of East End Avenue and 84th Street.

P.L. Sperr, photographer.
August 2, 1927.

folder: East End Avenue & 84th Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
East End Avenue, east side, south from 84th Street. August 2, 1927.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

folder: 84th Street & East End Avenue, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)

The former Schermerhorn residence, 9 Gracie Square, an extension of 84th Street, from East End Avenue to the East River. For a short time this was the nurses' home of the Italian Hospital.

August 30, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

A side view of the Schermerhorn residence, with Carl Schurz park in the background.

August 30, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: East End Avenue & 84th Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
North on East End Avenue from 84th Street.
March 29, 1929.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

Carl Schurz Park: This park consists of 13 acres, east of East End Ave., (left) to the East River and extending northward from Gracie Square (East 84th Street) to East 89th Street. The northern portion of this park was known as "Horn's Hook" and figured very prominently in the wars of the Revolution and 1812. This northern tip contains a spacious house, known as Gracie Mansion; built in 1813 by Archibald Gracie and now occupied by the Museum of the City of New York. Playground, walks, skating rink, landscape gardening, building improvements etc; all are the work of the W.P.A. Notice on the right the new Triboro Bridge (a P.W.A. project) silhouetted against the curved span of the Hellgate Bridge.

1936.

W.P.A. Photo
Federal Writers Project.
title: Manhattan: Carl Schurz Park.

folder: East End Avenue & 84th Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
East End Ave., south from East 85th (right), to East 84th (left) Streets, showing Miss Chapin's School, bearing No. 100, at the N.W. corner of the latter street, and the school playground at the S.W. corner of the former. On the east side of the street (foreground) appears the western extremity of Carl Schurz Park.

March 29, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: East 84th Street - East End Avenue (Gracie Square), Manhattan, NY
title: East 84th Street - East End Avenue (Gracie Square)
